body: Every week a Guardian Money reader submits a question, and it’s up to you to help him or her out – a selection of the best answers will appear in next Saturday’s paper. This week’s question: Last year we bought discounted National Trust membership at what was our only visit of the year. Now it wants £111 to renew. I want to support the charity but my husband says we should just “pay as we go”. Will it be money well spent? Do you have a problem readers could solve? Email your suggestions to money@theguardian.com or write to us at Money, The Guardian, Kings Place, 90 York Way, London N1 9GU.
webTitle: How can I convince my husband to renew our National Trust membership?
